page.title: 17Oystermouth Coastguards
page.content: The Mumbles Coastguard Station is built on Tutt Hill. From this position, on a clear day, Devon can be seen on the other side of the Bristol Channel. It is now the Headquarters for the Swansea Search & Rescue Region and covers an area from Ferryside in Dyfed to the River Parrett in Somerset. There are 13 regular Coastguards on watch-keeping duties and the Station is continually manned with 3 Officers on duty at a time. They are assisted by Auxiliary Coastguards. The Station's equipment includes VHF Radios, Telex, a Computer and a great number of books and charts for information. Emergency services are called out by Radio-Pager, or by direct and public telephone systems.
